column4: Good afternoon.  I'm having a recurring problem with sound getting stuck in a loop when either using a music app (Amarok) or watching flash vids on Firefox.  This will be the 3rd time I've needed to reboot this week, so it's getting a bit tedious.  I'm using Ibix, sound device: nVidia MCP61 HDA

Can anyone help, apart from upgrade to Jaunty (can't atm, it's a webdev box that I want to keep same release as production)?  I seriously can't believe I need to be rebooting so often to solve sound issues!
Should I *not* use pulseaudio on ibex?
No one can help with repeated audio issues?
repeated audio issues is vague, try being more specific

does it happen if you never use flash?
I couldn't say, I work as a webdev, disabling flash would be a bit of a problem.
I don't usually work while I troubleshoot
Currently on lunch break.  Problem is that it only happens every couple of days.
usually flash is the culprit so that would be my first guess.  Otherwise, check dmesg when it happens and play with pulse
Found odd kernal msg: "ppdev0: unregistered pardevice"
iirc, you are asked to set one during install
That's what I though.  I used synaptic.  It did not prompt me.
just reset the password I guess, the mysql docs have instructions
Aye, there's the deb hack.  Strange that I have to though.  I thought default pword was blank.  Something's obviously changed in karmic.
it did used to be blank but I seem to recall having to set a password in debconf so it must have changed.  It should have still worked even if you used synaptic though
